Award.AbstractNarration:
This award will support the travel costs of young researchers based at U.S. institutions, in the mathematical field of Geometric Group Theory, as they attend the Young Geometric Group Theory IV conference in Spa, Belgium, January 11-17, 2015. The week-long conference is designed to teach young researchers some of the tools they'll need to know to be productive members of their research communities. More information can be found at http://java.ugent.be/yggt4/.

This conference will feature four minicourses (on Hyperbolic groups, outer automorphisms of free groups, and buildings) and seven research talks, all aimed at the level of graduate students and other young researchers.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This award allowed for the participation of 18 graduate students and young mathematicians to the conference "Young Geometric Group Theory IV" that was held in Spa, Belgium on Janurary 11-17, 2015.

The conference was designed to educate young mathematicians on important topics in the field of Geometric Group Theory. The conference featured 4 extended minicourses---delivered by Danny Calegari (Chicago), Ursula Hamenstädt (Bonn), Denis Osin (Nashville), and Bertrand Rémy (Lyon)---as well as 7 research talks given by eraly stage mathematicians---Mark Hagen (Michigan), Aditi Kar (Oxford), Sara Maloni (Brown), Jean Raimbault (Toulouse), Petra Schwer (Münster), Alexey Talabutsa (Moscow), and Alden Walker (Chicago).

Below are the 18 recipients of funding from this award. Funding was used by the participants to pay for transportation to and from the conference, as well as for lodging at the conference site.

Carolyn Abbott (Wisconsin), Michael Cantrell (UIC), Mathew Cordes (Brandeis) Samuel Mark Corson (Vanderbilt), Benjamin Cote (UC Santa Barbara), Ellie Dannenberg (UIC), Saikat Das (Rutgers), Matthew Durham (Michigan), Eduard Einstein (Cornell), Michael Hull (UIC), Roman Kogan (Texas A & M), Doron Puder (IAS), Ahmad Rafiqi (Cornell), Andrew P. Sanchez (Tufts), Emily Stark (Tufts), Krzysztof Swiecicki (Texas A & M), Alexander Kai-Chi Taam (CUNY), and Caglar Uyanik (UIUC).
